home.title:
Vanhuffel
Bart
home.intro: Hey! I’m Bart, a programmer focused on full-stack development. I like clean interfaces, tidy code, and projects that feel truly finished. Outside of coding, you’ll usually find me hanging out with friends, listening to music, working out, or gaming.

hobbies.title: Hobbies
hobbies.lead: Two things that always recharge me: gaming and fitness.

other.title: Other hobbies
other.lead: Activities I enjoy alongside gaming and fitness, each offering a different kind of focus or relaxation.

dnd.title: D&D Dungeon Master
dnd.body: Running campaigns, building worlds, and guiding players through collaborative storytelling.

cardgames.title: Card games
cardgames.body: Enjoying strategic and social card games with friends.

skateboarding.title: Skateboarding
skateboarding.body: A fun way to stay active and clear my head outdoors.

cooking.title: Cooking
cooking.body: Experimenting in the kitchen and enjoying the process of creating good food.

gaming.title: Gaming
gaming.lead: Gaming has been a long-time hobby. I play on PC, PlayStation, and Switch, and I especially enjoy fantasy and story-driven games you can really get lost in.
gaming.whyBody: I started because my stepfather played a lot, and once I got my hands on the controller as a kid it stuck. For me it’s relaxation, inspiration, and sometimes simply escaping into another world.

fitness.title: Fitness
fitness.lead: Fitness is my straightforward way to stay healthy: get stronger, build energy, and keep my mind sharp. It feels great to see progress, even in small steps.
fitness.whyBody: I started because a friend invited me, and it became something that helps me stay disciplined and balanced. I’ve had on-and-off periods, but living close to a gym makes it much easier to train consistently.

education.title:
Programming
Associate Degree
education.body: I studied programming because I enjoy building digital products. After trying different jobs, I realized I always came back to computers and technology. Software development feels like the perfect mix of creativity and problem-solving.

other.title: Other education
other.lead: Before focusing fully on programming, I explored other fields. These experiences helped shape how I work and learn.

accounting.title: Accounting
accounting.body: A practical foundation in numbers, structure, and accuracy.

childcare.title: Childcare worker
childcare.body: People-focused work that strengthened patience, responsibility, and communication.

stw.title: Social Technical Sciences
stw.body: A broad background combining social topics with technical thinking.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.lead: A selection of projects I’m proud of, highlighting what I learned.

gleenie.name: Gleenie.org
gleenie.description: Gleenie.org is a durable programming project built in Laravel with a Tailwind frontend. It was a big learning opportunity on the frontend side: working with UI blocks and implementing from a design document.

ict21.name: ICT21
ict21.description: ICT21 is a Laravel-based project with a CMS system in the backend. Implementing it required a deep understanding of Filament resources. On top of that, I worked with Livewire for the contact form — a new experience I really valued.

gogomon.name: Gogomon
gogomon.description: Gogomon is a fitness mobile/smartwatch app I built in a team. We planned the database and API, researched platforms, and built primarily in .NET MAUI. We also shipped a Wear OS side. We learned a lot about GDPR as well, which was an important learning moment.

deckbuilder.name: Deckbuilder
deckbuilder.description: My Deckbuilder MVC web app was created to learn REST APIs. I worked with request and result models and learned a ton about loose coupling. The app also taught me a lot about sessions and JWT tokens, which I found particularly interesting.
